description: Borrowed from German Skopolamin, from translingual Scopolia (“genus of plants”) +‎ German Amin (“amine”).

entries.meaning: (pharmacology) A poisonous alkaloid C17H21NO4 similar to atropine that is found in various solanaceous plants and is used for its anticholinergic effects (such as preventing nausea in motion sickness and inducing mydriasis).
